definitions: To make something accessible or available.
To start a business or activity.
To talk more freely and express one's feelings.
To create a gap or space.
To make something wider or less restricted.
examples: They decided to open up a new branch.
She needs to open up about her problems.
The road will open up to a beautiful valley.
The new policy will open up opportunities.
He tried to open up the tightly sealed jar.
